instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2850: What is 820-2850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.C9560: What is C9560? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2850 logic board that often dies and causes intermittent power to framebuffer PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS and PP1V8R1V55_S0GPU_ISNS_R rail, causing GPU kernel panics. Replace with non-tantalum if machine is having random black screen or kernel panics.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message:
I tried to do nvram reset on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A and it will chime when I am doing those key sequence. However, subsequent bootup has no chime again. 

But sound works after boot into macos and volume up/down is also working.

What could be the cause of this?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message: Do you get sound on all speakers?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message: yes I do. any idea? possible bad spi?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message:
You can try to reflash BIOS.
But is so important the chime???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message: no but something is wrong right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no chime even after nvram reset, but sound works after bootup
threads.message:
Test it, run a GPU bechmark.
If no issues, call it "repaired".

Change <CAPACITOR>C9560</CAPACITOR>, just in case.
